name: CoRoT-22
scenarioDescription:
The CoRoT-22 Exoplanetary System


Overview

CoRoT-22 is a star with 1.1 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.14 times its radius. It is located 1930.84 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

CoRoT-22 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the CoRoT-22 system


CoRoT-22 b

CoRoT-22 b was discovered by the CoRoT observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of CoRoT-22 b is 12.084 times the mass of Earth. The radius of CoRoT-22 b is 4.88 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, CoRoT-22 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system CoRoT-22, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by CoRoT.
